summary: The Department of Energy said that about 700,000 pounds of mercury were released during nuclear weapons production at its site in Oak Ridge, TN. Mercury contamination is a health and environmental hazard. DOE estimates that mercury cleanup at this site could cost at least $3.2 billion and take until 2043. This Q&A covers how these estimates could grow due to DOE's risk management approach. For...
title: Oak Ridge Mercury Cleanup: Opportunities Exist to Enhance Risk Management and Technology Development
